    <item>
      <title>Why Donald Trump Needs Paul Ryan</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/why_donald_trump_needs_paul_ryan.html</link>
      <description><p>On Thursday, Donald Trump came to Washington <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/donald-trump-paul-ryan-gop.html?_r=0">to make nice with Paul Ryan</a>, speaker of the House of Representatives and de facto leader of the “establishment” Republican Party. The meeting, Ryan told reporters, went well. “Donald Trump and I have had our differences—we talked about those differences today,” he said, adding, “I do believe that we are now planting the seeds to get ourselves unified.”</p></description>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:18:09 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/why_donald_trump_needs_paul_ryan.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>Jamelle Bouie</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T22:18:09Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>The man who can’t be bought is courting the GOP donor class now.</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>

    <item>
      <title>“All I Can Say Is That This Is a Very Dumb Country”</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/gop_voters_who_don_t_like_trump_on_who_they_will_vote_for.html</link>
      <description><p>Back in early March, <a href="http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/03/republicans_against_trump_on_what_they_ll_do_if_he_s_the_nominee.html">I went looking for GOP voters</a> who didn’t love Donald Trump. This was not a scientific undertaking—my sample size was 13 people, found through my own social and professional networks. I just wanted a glimpse of the thought process of longtime Republicans who were uncomfortable making Trump their party’s nominee. How did they plan to vote in November, should Trump in fact make the ballot versus Hillary Clinton?</p></description>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:57:06 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/gop_voters_who_don_t_like_trump_on_who_they_will_vote_for.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>Seth Stevenson</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T20:57:06Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>Checking back in with our panel of GOP voters who don’t like Trump to see where they stand today.&nbsp;</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>
      <slate:menuline>Checking Back in With Our Panel of GOP Voters Who Don’t Like Trump to See Where They Stand Today</slate:menuline>
      <slate:id>100160512013</slate:id>
      <slate:topic display_name="2016 campaign" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/2016_campaign">2016 campaign</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="donald trump" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/donald_trump">donald trump</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="gop primary 2016" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/gop_primary_2016">gop primary 2016</slate:topic>
      <slate:author display_name="Seth Stevenson" path="/etc/tags/authors/seth_stevenson" url="http://www.slate.com/authors.seth_stevenson.html">Seth Stevenson</slate:author>
      <slate:rubric display_name="Politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_rubric/politics">Politics</slate:rubric>
      <slate:legacy_url>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/gop_voters_who_don_t_like_trump_on_who_they_will_vote_for.html</slate:legacy_url>
      <slate:slate_plus>false</slate:slate_plus>
      <slate:paywall>false</slate:paywall>
      <slate:sponsored>false</slate:sponsored>
      <slate:tw-line>Checking back in with GOP voters who don’t like Trump to see where they stand today:</slate:tw-line>
      <slate:fb-share>“All I can say is that this is a very dumb country.”</slate:fb-share>
      <media:group>
        <media:content medium="image" height="346" width="568" url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160512_POL_trump-traditional-republican.jpg.CROP.rectangle-large.jpg">
          <media:credit role="producer" scheme="urn:ebu">Matt Mills McKnight/Getty Images</media:credit>
          <media:description>Supporters are greeted by Donald Trump after a rally on May 7 in Lynden, Washington.</media:description>
          <media:thumbnail url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160512_POL_trump-traditional-republican.jpg.CROP.thumbnail-small.jpg" width="274" height="238" />
        </media:content>
      </media:group>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Never Goldwater</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/never_goldwater_the_failed_attempt_to_wrest_the_1964_gop_nomination_from.html</link>
      <description><p><em>This article is adapted from <a></a><a href="http://www.amazon.com/dp/145554048X/?tag=slatmaga-20">Whistlestop: My Favorite Stories From Presidential Campaign History</a>.<br /> </em><br /> <strong>Rocky Go Home</strong></p></description>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:34:58 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/never_goldwater_the_failed_attempt_to_wrest_the_1964_gop_nomination_from.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>John Dickerson</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T20:34:58Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>The attempt to wrest the 1964 GOP nomination from the Arizona senator and the birth of the modern GOP.</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>
      <slate:menuline>Never Goldwater: How the Fight to Defeat the Arizona Senator Gave Birth to the Modern GOP</slate:menuline>
      <slate:id>100160512011</slate:id>
      <slate:topic display_name="politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/politics0">politics</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="history" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/history">history</slate:topic>
      <slate:author display_name="John Dickerson" path="/etc/tags/authors/john_dickerson" url="http://www.slate.com/authors.john_dickerson.html">John Dickerson</slate:author>
      <slate:rubric display_name="Politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_rubric/politics">Politics</slate:rubric>
      <slate:legacy_url>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/never_goldwater_the_failed_attempt_to_wrest_the_1964_gop_nomination_from.html</slate:legacy_url>
      <slate:slate_plus>false</slate:slate_plus>
      <slate:paywall>false</slate:paywall>
      <slate:sponsored>false</slate:sponsored>
      <slate:tw-line>Never Goldwater: An exclusive excerpt from @jdickerson’s forthcoming book.</slate:tw-line>
      <slate:fb-share>The ideological warfare on the floor of the Cow Palace makes 2016 look tame by comparison.</slate:fb-share>
      <media:group>
        <media:content medium="image" height="346" width="568" url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160511_POL_64-Goldwater-Wave.jpg.CROP.rectangle-large.jpg">
          <media:credit role="producer" scheme="urn:ebu">AP Images</media:credit>
          <media:description>The fight to stop Sen. Barry Goldwater was about first principles and values, not just tactical disputes. Above, Goldwater waves to delegates at the 1964 GOP convention.</media:description>
          <media:thumbnail url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160511_POL_64-Goldwater-Wave.jpg.CROP.thumbnail-small.jpg" width="274" height="238" />
        </media:content>
      </media:group>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>How to Stop the Next Trump</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/how_to_stop_the_next_trump.html</link>
      <description><p>Say it’s Wednesday, Nov. 9, and Hillary Clinton, a very unpopular politician, has just defeated Donald Trump, a historically unpopular politician, by a safe popular-vote margin and a landslide Electoral College tally. This is by no means a foregone conclusion, but it is a distinct possibility. And say you’re the people who run the Republican Party: Republican National Committee officials, state party leaders, and so forth. You saw this coming <a href="http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/trump_is_no_romney_rubio_or_kasich_just_look_at_the_polls.html">a mile away</a>, and you want to make sure that this—your primary electorate selecting an agonizingly unelectable candidate as your nominee in an election you should’ve won—never happens again.</p></description>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:01:57 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/how_to_stop_the_next_trump.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>Jim Newell</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T20:01:57Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>The GOP could change the nominating rules. Or it could change itself.</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>
      <slate:menuline>How to Stop the Next Trump</slate:menuline>
      <slate:id>100160512010</slate:id>
      <slate:topic display_name="2016 campaign" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/2016_campaign">2016 campaign</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="gop primary 2016" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/gop_primary_2016">gop primary 2016</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="donald trump" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/donald_trump">donald trump</slate:topic>
      <slate:author display_name="Jim Newell" path="/etc/tags/authors/jim_newell" url="http://www.slate.com/authors.jim_newell.html">Jim Newell</slate:author>
      <slate:rubric display_name="Politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_rubric/politics">Politics</slate:rubric>
      <slate:legacy_url>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/how_to_stop_the_next_trump.html</slate:legacy_url>
      <slate:slate_plus>false</slate:slate_plus>
      <slate:paywall>false</slate:paywall>
      <slate:sponsored>false</slate:sponsored>
      <slate:tw-line>How to stop the next Trump:</slate:tw-line>
      <slate:fb-share>The GOP could change the nominating rules. Or it could change itself.</slate:fb-share>
      <media:group>
        <media:content medium="image" height="346" width="568" url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160511_POL_RNC-trump.jpg.CROP.rectangle-large.jpg">
          <media:credit role="producer" scheme="urn:ebu">Jason Redmond/Getty Images</media:credit>
          <media:description>Donald Trump addresses a campaign stop at the Northwest Washington Fair and Event Center in Lynden, Washington, on May 7.</media:description>
          <media:thumbnail url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160511_POL_RNC-trump.jpg.CROP.thumbnail-small.jpg" width="274" height="238" />
        </media:content>
      </media:group>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>The Worst Republican for the Job</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/trump_is_no_romney_rubio_or_kasich_just_look_at_the_polls.html</link>
      <description><p>Donald Trump has big plans for the general election. He’s going to bring millions of new voters into the Republican Party. He’s going to sweep the industrial Midwest. “I will win Michigan. … I will win Pennsylvania. … I will win Florida,” Trump <a href="http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/1605/04/sitroom.02.html">predicted last week</a>. “New York is in play,” too, he said. “I will win Upstate New York by massive numbers. I will win out on Long Island by massive numbers. … I will win sections of [New York] City that nobody else could win.”</p></description>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 00:24:30 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/trump_is_no_romney_rubio_or_kasich_just_look_at_the_polls.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>William Saletan</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T00:24:30Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>Trump is no Romney, Rubio, or Kasich. Just look at the polls.</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>
      <slate:menuline>The Worst Republican for the Job</slate:menuline>
      <slate:id>100160511019</slate:id>
      <slate:topic display_name="2016 campaign" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/2016_campaign">2016 campaign</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="gop primary 2016" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/gop_primary_2016">gop primary 2016</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="donald trump" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/donald_trump">donald trump</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="mitt romney" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/mitt_romney0">mitt romney</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="marco rubio" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/marco_rubio0">marco rubio</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="john kasich" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/john_kasich">john kasich</slate:topic>
      <slate:author display_name="William Saletan" path="/etc/tags/authors/william_saletan" url="http://www.slate.com/authors.william_saletan.html">William Saletan</slate:author>
      <slate:rubric display_name="Politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_rubric/politics">Politics</slate:rubric>
      <slate:legacy_url>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/trump_is_no_romney_rubio_or_kasich_just_look_at_the_polls.html</slate:legacy_url>
      <slate:slate_plus>false</slate:slate_plus>
      <slate:paywall>false</slate:paywall>
      <slate:sponsored>false</slate:sponsored>
      <slate:tw-line>Trump is no Romney, Rubio, or Kasich. Just look at the polls:</slate:tw-line>
      <slate:fb-share>By nominating Trump instead of Kasich or Rubio, the GOP has sacrificed more than 40 points in net favorability.</slate:fb-share>
      <media:group>
        <media:content medium="video" duration="310" type="video/mp4" url="http://brightcove04.brightcove.com/34/78144477/201510/1886/78144477_4568837917001_Donald-Trump-Atlantic-Ctiy-sept-v4.mp4?videoId=4510013042001">
          <slate:playerID>1519028539001</slate:playerID>
          <slate:playerKey>AQ~~,AAAAAASoY90~,_gW1ZHvKG_2pKN0AJTySft1Irx-gT62t</slate:playerKey>
          <slate:videoPlayer>4510013042001</slate:videoPlayer>
          <slate:videoList>4553233456001</slate:videoList>
        </media:content>
        <media:content medium="video" bitrate="1799.0" expression="full" fileSize="69067422" height="720" width="1280" url="http://brightcove04.brightcove.com/34/78144477/201510/3906/78144477_4568873301001_Donald-Trump-Atlantic-Ctiy-sept-v4.mp4">
          <slate:playerID>1519028539001</slate:playerID>
          <slate:playerKey>AQ~~,AAAAAASoY90~,_gW1ZHvKG_2pKN0AJTySft1Irx-gT62t</slate:playerKey>
          <slate:videoPlayer>4510013042001</slate:videoPlayer>
          <slate:videoList>4553233456001</slate:videoList>
        </media:content>
        <media:content medium="video" bitrate="499.0" expression="full" fileSize="19513232" height="268" width="480" url="http://brightcove04.brightcove.com/34/78144477/201510/1886/78144477_4568837917001_Donald-Trump-Atlantic-Ctiy-sept-v4.mp4">
          <slate:playerID>1519028539001</slate:playerID>
          <slate:playerKey>AQ~~,AAAAAASoY90~,_gW1ZHvKG_2pKN0AJTySft1Irx-gT62t</slate:playerKey>
          <slate:videoPlayer>4510013042001</slate:videoPlayer>
          <slate:videoList>4553233456001</slate:videoList>
        </media:content>
        <media:content medium="video" bitrate="143.0" expression="full" fileSize="5691207" height="224" width="400" url="http://brightcove04.brightcove.com/34/78144477/201510/662/78144477_4568850454001_Donald-Trump-Atlantic-Ctiy-sept-v4.mp4">
          <slate:playerID>1519028539001</slate:playerID>
          <slate:playerKey>AQ~~,AAAAAASoY90~,_gW1ZHvKG_2pKN0AJTySft1Irx-gT62t</slate:playerKey>
          <slate:videoPlayer>4510013042001</slate:videoPlayer>
          <slate:videoList>4553233456001</slate:videoList>
        </media:content>
        <media:content medium="video" bitrate="800.0" expression="full" fileSize="30790071" height="360" width="640" url="http://brightcove04.brightcove.com/34/78144477/201510/1594/78144477_4568859660001_Donald-Trump-Atlantic-Ctiy-sept-v4.mp4">
          <slate:playerID>1519028539001</slate:playerID>
          <slate:playerKey>AQ~~,AAAAAASoY90~,_gW1ZHvKG_2pKN0AJTySft1Irx-gT62t</slate:playerKey>
          <slate:videoPlayer>4510013042001</slate:videoPlayer>

    <item>
      <title>Trumpsplaining</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/a_trumpsplainer_on_what_the_gop_candidate_s_voters_are_thinking_when_they.html</link>
      <description><p>A little while ago, <strong><em>Slate</em></strong>’s Isaac Chotiner pointed to one of the ways that conservative entertainers like Bill O’Reilly of Fox News have aided Donald Trump’s presidential campaign. Rather than defend Trump’s more outlandish remarks—like claiming that Ted Cruz’s father was involved in the plot to assassinate John F. Kennedy—O’Reilly and his ilk seek to <a href="http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2016/05/04/bill_o_reilly_explains_donald_trump_to_charles_krauthammer.html">explain them</a>. In doing so, Chotiner argues, they’ve helped normalize his extreme behavior and made it seem palatable to a large segment of the electorate. I see his point.</p></description>
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 12:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/a_trumpsplainer_on_what_the_gop_candidate_s_voters_are_thinking_when_they.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>Reihan Salam</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-11T12:00:00Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>What the GOP candidate’s voters are thinking when they call for a ban on Muslim immigration.</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>
      <slate:menuline>What Trump Voters Are Thinking When They Support a Ban on Muslim Immigration</slate:menuline>
      <slate:id>100160511003</slate:id>

      <slate:topic display_name="politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/politics0">politics</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="gop primary 2016" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/gop_primary_2016">gop primary 2016</slate:topic>

      <slate:sponsored>false</slate:sponsored>
      <slate:tw-line>What Trump voters are thinking when they support a ban on Muslim immigration:</slate:tw-line>

        </media:content>
      </media:group>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>The Myth of the Disappearing Nonwhite Voter</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/black_and_latino_voters_aren_t_going_anywhere.html</link>
      <description><p>The first “swing state” surveys of 2016 are here, and the news isn’t good for Hillary Clinton. According to <a href="https://www.qu.edu/news-and-events/quinnipiac-university-poll/2016-presidential-swing-state-polls/release-detail?ReleaseID=2345">a new Quinnipiac poll</a>, the likely Democratic nominee is just a nose ahead of Donald Trump in Florida and Pennsylvania, where she leads 43 percent to Trump’s 42. In Ohio, she’s behind, 39 percent to Trump’s 43.</p></description>
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 21:26:42 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/black_and_latino_voters_aren_t_going_anywhere.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>Jamelle Bouie</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-10T21:26:42Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>Blacks and Latinos aren’t sitting out an Obama-less 2016—especially not with Trump on the ballot.</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>
      <slate:menuline>The Myth of the Disappearing Nonwhite Voter</slate:menuline>
      <slate:id>100160510010</slate:id>
      <slate:topic display_name="2016 campaign" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/2016_campaign">2016 campaign</slate:topic>

      <slate:topic display_name="barack obama" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/barack_obama0">barack obama</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="race" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/race0">race</slate:topic>
      <slate:author display_name="Jamelle Bouie" path="/etc/tags/authors/jamelle_bouie" url="http://www.slate.com/authors.jamelle_bouie.html">Jamelle Bouie</slate:author>
      <slate:rubric display_name="Politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_rubric/politics">Politics</slate:rubric>
      <slate:legacy_url>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/black_and_latino_voters_aren_t_going_anywhere.html</slate:legacy_url>
      <slate:slate_plus>false</slate:slate_plus>
      <slate:paywall>false</slate:paywall>
      <slate:sponsored>false</slate:sponsored>
      <slate:tw-line>The myth of the disappearing nonwhite voter:</slate:tw-line>
      <slate:fb-share>Blacks and Latinos aren’t sitting out 2016—especially not with Trump on the ballot.</slate:fb-share>

        <media:content medium="image" height="346" width="568" url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160510_POL_black-latino-voters.jpg.CROP.rectangle-large.jpg">

        </media:content>

    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Trump Can’t Pivot</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/donald_trump_can_t_pivot.html</link>
      <description><p>Thus far, in the narrative of the 2016 presidential election, Donald Trump is the “unpredictable” one who will scramble the fall election. What this means in practice is that everything Trump says feeds the narrative, even if, after the most cursory examination, it doesn’t fit. And so Monday, for example, we’re told the wily Trump has shifted positions on taxes and the minimum wage, craftily moving toward Hillary Clinton’s left ahead of the general.</p></description>
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 21:48:50 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/donald_trump_can_t_pivot.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>Jamelle Bouie</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-09T21:48:50Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>The pundits who say he’s going moderate are missing something.</slate:dek>

    <item>
      <title>Who Is This Ben Sasse Guy?</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/who_is_ben_sasse_and_why_does_anyone_want_him_running_for_president.html</link>
      <description><p>The hollowed-out husk of Never Trump conservatism now finds its salvation not in some unworkable alliance of Ted Cruz and John Kasich plucking off delegates, but instead in the junior senator from Nebraska. He’s something of an oddball, this Ben Sasse; he feels his feelings deeply and <a href="https://www.facebook.com/sassefornebraska/posts/593031420862025">jots them down on Facebook</a> while sitting by the Platte River. After much feeling of his feelings, he has arrived at the conclusion that a third candidate should join and win this presidential election. Should be a cinch.</p></description>
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 21:07:54 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/who_is_ben_sasse_and_why_does_anyone_want_him_running_for_president.html</guid>
      <dc:creator>Jim Newell</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-09T21:07:54Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>And why does anyone want him running as a third-party candidate for president?</slate:dek>
      <slate:section>News and Politics</slate:section>
      <slate:menuline>Who Is Ben Sasse, and Why Does Anyone Want Him Running for President?</slate:menuline>
      <slate:id>100160509010</slate:id>
      <slate:topic display_name="2016 campaign" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/2016_campaign">2016 campaign</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="gop primary 2016" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/gop_primary_2016">gop primary 2016</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="republicans" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/republicans">republicans</slate:topic>
      <slate:topic display_name="donald trump" path="/etc/tags/slate_topics/donald_trump">donald trump</slate:topic>
      <slate:author display_name="Jim Newell" path="/etc/tags/authors/jim_newell" url="http://www.slate.com/authors.jim_newell.html">Jim Newell</slate:author>
      <slate:rubric display_name="Politics" path="/etc/tags/slate_rubric/politics">Politics</slate:rubric>
      <slate:legacy_url>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/who_is_ben_sasse_and_why_does_anyone_want_him_running_for_president.html</slate:legacy_url>
      <slate:slate_plus>false</slate:slate_plus>
      <slate:paywall>false</slate:paywall>
      <slate:sponsored>false</slate:sponsored>
      <slate:tw-line>Who is @BenSasse, and why does anyone want him running for president?</slate:tw-line>
      <slate:fb-share>The hunt for the True Conservative unicorn is on.</slate:fb-share>
      <media:group>
        <media:content medium="image" height="346" width="568" url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160509_POL_Ben-Sasse.jpg.CROP.rectangle-large.jpg">
          <media:credit role="producer" scheme="urn:ebu">Saul Loeb/AFP/Getty Images</media:credit>
          <media:description>U.S. Sen. Ben Sasse, Republican of Nebraska, during the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) at National Harbor in Oxon Hill, Maryland, March 3, 2016.</media:description>
          <media:thumbnail url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160509_POL_Ben-Sasse.jpg.CROP.thumbnail-small.jpg" width="274" height="238" />
        </media:content>
      </media:group>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Why Republicans Who Hate Trump Are Afraid to Say So</title>
      <link>http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/why_republicans_who_hate_trump_are_afraid_to_say_so.html</link>
      <description><p><em>This article appears in slightly different form in the </em>Financial Times<em>.</em></p></description>
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 18:01:00 GMT</pubDate>

      <dc:creator>Jacob Weisberg</dc:creator>
      <dc:date>2016-05-09T18:01:00Z</dc:date>
      <slate:dek>The consequences of breaking with the party are heavy. But what about the consequences of loyalty to a bad cause?</slate:dek>

        <media:content medium="image" height="346" width="568" url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160509_POL_ReaganBaker.jpg.CROP.rectangle-large.jpg">
          <media:credit role="producer" scheme="urn:ebu">Dirck Halstead/Liaison</media:credit>
          <media:description>Who will be our era’s Howard Baker? Above, President Ronald Reagan meets with Howard Baker in the Cabinet Room of the White House on Sept. 30, 1981, in Washington.</media:description>
          <media:thumbnail url="http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/articles/news_and_politics/politics/2016/05/160509_POL_ReaganBaker.jpg.CROP.thumbnail-small.jpg" width="274" height="238" />
        </media:content>
      </media:group>
    </item>
